CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 5 reads: "Top Producers in "Y" Campaign - Top producers in recent Centre Avenue YMCA membership campaign, received their awards for bringing in the most members and points at a dinner meeting at the "Y" on Monday evening. Left to right: MRs. James M. Burgette, who received a hair dryer for corralling the most points among the women; Frank E. Bolden, who won an electric blanket and an attache case for having both the highest number of members and points among the men; Mrs. Bolden, who assisted her husband in holding his awards, and Mrs. Sara Robinson, who accepted the award for the ill Mis Lucille Wyant, who garnered the most members among the women campaigners. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of top producers in Centre Avenue YMCA membership campaign, from left: Mrs. James M. Burgette, Frank E. Bolden, Mrs. Bolden, and Sara Robinson holding awards, in YMCA with Henry O. Tanner painting "Christ and His Mother"
